resources.string:
For more information and exercises, look up the following resources:

* Douglas Harding's work, for example at headless.org
* Eckhart Tolle
* Zen Buddhism and for example the Heart Sutra
Welcome! We will try to demonstrate different views of yourself and the world, and why it\'s important to consider these.
This is how you see yourself, how you want to present yourself to others or how others see you.
This is what you see, how you are to yourself.
When you see yourself or when you pay attention to how others see you, your mind is mostly turned inward. Suddenly your mind is a barrier to directly experiencing the world.
When you are yourself, you are free, open, a space for the world. Sights, sounds, tastes, smells and touches happen within you.
If you pay attention to your mind when you\'re interacting with people and when you\'re thinking and not thinking, you will see what a difference this makes.
Thank you for participating in this exercise!
